name: Mosaic Virus
solution: There is no cure for viral infections, but preventive measures include using virus-free seeds, controlling insect vectors, and practicing good crop hygiene.
symptom: Mottled or mosaic-like patterns on leaves, stunted growth.

name: Hoppers and Bugs (Pest Injury)
solution: Use insecticides and adopt integrated pest management strategies. Beneficial insects like ladybugs can be introduced to control pest populations.
symptom: Holes in leaves, wilting, general plant decline.

name: Pest Injury
solution: Varied depending on the specific pest. Insecticides, traps, and cultural practices like crop rotation can be effective.
symptom: Depends on the pest but may include chewed leaves, distorted growth.

name: Tikka Leaf Spot
solution: Fungicides, crop rotation, and removing infected plant material can help control the disease.
symptom: Small, dark spots on leaves, which may enlarge and develop a concentric ring pattern.

name: Phytoplasma (Bacteria)
solution: There is no direct cure for phytoplasma infections. Prevention includes using disease-free planting material and controlling insect vectors.
symptom: Yellowing, stunted growth, and various deformities in leaves.

name: Rust Disease
solution: Fungicides, genetic resistance, and proper plant spacing to improve air circulation can help manage rust diseases.
symptom: Rust-colored pustules on leaves, often leading to leaf yellowing and premature leaf drop.
